website_summaries.verdict: This is the way to go if you want a lightweight stick vacuum that you can use anywhere, even if you're not near an outlet.
pros: Stick bends in the middle to enable you to easily reach underneath objects
Good at sucking up pet hair
cons: The dirt cup capacity is small, so you must empty it regularly

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I've had it 10 months and the brush head motor stopped working after screaming and turning off on it's own. I've kept it very clean and have followed trouble shooting recommendations. Can't get any help from manufacturer. This was a big purchase for me as I'm a single mother of a severe special needs adult son and we usually buy from Goodwill. I'm very frustrated and disappointed. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Debra K.

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life and over heats. Terrible to clean out and empty.
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved Shark products, but this one is not for a large house. It's more for a studio apartment. I really wish I returned it right when I got it. 2 batteries don't even last long enough to do the house and it over heats and shuts down all the time. In my opinion only good for very small spaces. And then at the price point it's too expensive to only be good for that.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Asali

customer_reviews.title: Was great. But now I've had it not even two ...
customer_reviews.text: Was great. But now I've had it not even two months and the bottom snaps into place but doesn't work at all. Ridiculous. Edit. They did allow me to purchase a new one that does work. But now it's a few months later again, and it won't suck anything up. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: sumer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is fantastic! Picks up what my previous other premium brand missed. It does get closer to walls, furniture, etc. plus has an attachment that will reach under furniture that is close to the carpet. I am elderly and find this easier to use than any other vacuum I have had AND I think it is better than any other vacuum I have had.
customer_reviews.author: KRS

customer_reviews.title: Great Vacuum while it worked
customer_reviews.text: Great Vacuum while it worked. Bought 2/8/18 stopped working 3/17/18. Trouble shooting indicating a clog. We cleared and cleaned everything and other than the slightly soiled filter there were no clogs. We called Shark and they went through troubleshooting same as we already did and same result. We the lights would light and flash and turn off and vacuum not starting. The representative stated the part needed was not in stock but they would replace it but none in stock so it would take 4-6 weeks to get a new one and we needed to provide our own box and pay shipping. We said no. We will return to Amazon I hope!
customer_reviews.author: NurseTom

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this Shark product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this Shark product. Low suction, battery life 10 to 20 minutes max. I spent 35 minutes on the phone with a customer specialist. Got the suction a little better. Finally got off the phone and the machine stopped working completely. The customer rep confirmed that the life span of the batteries were only 10 to 20 minutes. i would never purchase this product again - i can't believe all the great reviews it has received.
customer_reviews.author: patricia f casey

customer_reviews.title: Much cheaper and better
customer_reviews.text: Suction was not adequate. Bought the shark lift away corded. Much cheaper and better suction
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Lacks Power, Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We tried to like this cordless vacuum but it simply lacked the suction power of our old inexpensive corded Hoover. So we returned it to Amazon. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Broken after one use!
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a Dyson user but when I saw this product I was so excited to try something new. It was very easy to assemble and the first time I used it I thought it was great. Disappointed that the docking station and extra battery was additional, but pleased with the performance anyway. UNTIL I used it for the second time the next day and the floor/carpet button was nonfunctioning and now won't suction anything at all! Very disappointed and will be returning, which is a whole other pain because I have to box it all up and take the time to ship it back!!!
customer_reviews.author: amy liggett

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little vacuum! I love how easy it is to use and the “self-propelled” action on carpet. I find it cleans both floors and carpet quite well. My only complaint is that the battery does not last on high power mode. It does clean quite well even in extended run mode, but I feel it does a better job in high power mode. It comes with 2 batteries thank goodness. I may order a third since I have a fairly large home.
customer_reviews.author: Laura C.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely loved this vacuum for the three months that it actually ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved this vacuum for the three months that it actually worked. I am currently working on a way to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: After owning 3 Dyson cordless vacs, decided to take a chance on the Shark cordless since their corded vacs are as good as the Dyson corded in my opinion. Just tried the new Shark duoclean cordless and I Hate it! Anemic suction on carpets. I have 4 dogs, I need a vacuum that really sucks! This duoclean is like a play vac. Sending it back and going back to Dyson
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Kaasa

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum. Get it. I did!
customer_reviews.text: We love this vacuum. The extra removable battery was really the deciding factor, and price to some extent, over the Dyson v10. Being able to swap batteries is great. The suction power is pretty amazing as well. Pretty much the same as my corded Dyson upright. I wasn’t expecting the sound however. It’s so quiet! (Compared to the Dyson upright). It sounds like a cordless drill running as full power.
customer_reviews.author: DaBears

customer_reviews.title: My favorite vacuum ever~
customer_reviews.text: What a great vacuum...I had another brand cordless, which I also loved, but it would always run out of battery before I could finish cleaning. That problem is solved with this terrific little work horse. I am a clean freak and I hate having to plug in vacuums. I also had a several thousand dollar Mille Vacuum and love this even more. Couldn't be happier, and with two batteries, I should never run out of time to finish cleaning my very large home.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Russell

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!! I bought this vacuum in late October and didn't use it until mid November. After about four or five uses the brushes stopped spinning. I call Shark and worked through their troubleshooting process and finally got them to work again. Two months later and the same thing happens only this time, working with the Shark rep, the troubleshooting steps do not work!! Shark says I need a new head for the vac. $80.00 head!!!!! THE HEAD IS NOT WARRANTED!! I cant throw away a $300.00 vac. and I cant return it now to Amazon ! Finally she says she will sell it to me at 50% off that price. UNBELIEVABLE. MY LAST SHARK PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda G. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Use a broom instead!
customer_reviews.text: After only 2 minutes of using the Shark DuoClean on my hardwood flooring, it shuts off and the “overheating” lights start blinking. I’ve cleaned every filter multiple times. Very frustrating. Too much hassle and $ to return, so I’m keeping it and going back to my trusty broom. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: stacy jo klemetson

customer_reviews.title: We are Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I just love this vaccum cleaner. Being cordless makes usage very quick and handy. Suction is more than adequate. We highly recommend this shark ninja
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Z. Jackubowski

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is not good !
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 2 battery pack and one on low speed last about 10 min. This is not at all acceptable on a new vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the vacuum 28 days ago and i have already had a problem. I called Shark as instructed and went through the troubleshooting to no avail. The customer service person indicated that it was not covered by the warranty 28 days after the purchase and that i would have to purchase the defective part. The he told me to call amazon for resolution because i did not purchase it directly from them. Way to stand behind your product. it's the ez bake oven of vacuum cleaners.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Battery does die kinda quick in my opinion but I still love so mch I don’t even care
customer_reviews.text: Mixed feelings! As far as the vacume it’s self I am obsessed, it can go places I never thought possiable and is so convenient with no cord! Battery does die kinda quick in my opinion but I still love so mch I don’t even care! As far as the one I received it was terriable, it was missing tons of peices and shut off immediately when it hit carpet! I returned to amazon and went to my local store to buy. so happy I did
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed. I was waffling back and forth between this and the more expensive dyson. Glad I saved a few bucks and went with this one. We have primarily hard wood floors and two log hair cats. This does the job on both the cat hair fuzz balls, litter tracked on the floor and any dirt found in between. Its light, easy to use and store and love the extra battery pack. Plus I love the battery charging station versus the dyson which requires you hook the main component head up for charging.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Scorpio

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this vacuum when I first received it. But the performance after a year is disappointing. It does not always pick up something as small as a partial cat treat and it leaves a lot behind. After I am done vacuuming and put it down a lot of the dirt, etc. that was picked up falls out. I have tried leaving it on for a minute to make sure it is all suctioned in but it still falls out. The suction on this has really gone downhill. I would not buy this product again
customer_reviews.author: PSS

customer_reviews.title: This sucks. No really..it’s sucks.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: seems to clog often, floor roller is destroyed after only a month on hardwood floors. Batteries do not last even a full house vacuum (1000 sq ft). Plus, we have the corded version of this and none of the parts are interchangeable such as attachments and rollers. Dumb idea to make more $ Shark. Love this thing! Batteries do die quick as we use this almost every day. 4 kids living on a farm can do that. We just always have a charged one ready. Much more convenient then a corded vacuum and the suction is fantastic. My only gripe is the hardwood floor roller already wore out after only a week. A replacement would sure be nice.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry and Fun to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very flexible, wonderful for going under beds, and around objects. Vacuum does grab small carpets and shakes them like an angry dog. After picking up some corn starch spilled on the floor it took a little while to clean the powder out but dust and heavier stuff like sand are vacuumed up and easy to dump.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn A. Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: My favorite vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 different vacuums in my house: one canister, one upright, one robotic and this one. This cordless vacuum is my favorite of all. I do have hardwood floors all over the house so I do not know how it would work on carpet. I do have a dog that sheds all the time and this has been great at removing all that hair. I like it that it came with 2 batteries so if I ran out of juice in one I can just pop in the second one to finish the job. I certainly recommend this device to all who need a cordless vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: anitalala

customer_reviews.title: Pricey accessories
customer_reviews.text: This is a big improvement over my old, corded clunker. And I think it will work well on my all-hardwood floors. I'm disappointed that the two batteries came with only a single charger and dock. As it takes quite a while to charge a battery, I'll want to have both fully charged before starting a major clean-up. Shark does offer a double charger and dock, but you have to buy it separately from them...for $69.95 plus (hefty) shipping charge. Still, this is a light-weight, mobile option for the job of vacuuming. Yay to that.
customer_reviews.author: ReadProf

customer_reviews.title: Great suction and battery life for my apartment, furniture, and Jeep
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is awesome. I use it on the linoleum hardwood floors all the light my 1 bedroom apartment. It gets all the dog hair off the floors and couches. I use it to vacuum out from Jeep constantly. While it’s not quite a shop vac it still works surprisingly well in the Jeep for dog hair, sand (there’s always sand fro the beach and other things) on the max power setting. Batteries are great. Even on Mac power I still get about 20 min out of each which is more than enough for anything I need it for. Defiantly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Edited: piece of trash - difficult to clean if you own a dog
customer_reviews.text: Edited: downgrading this review to 1-star. The vacuum is an absolute piece of trash. It can't even pick up most pieces of dust or debris. I'm back to doing a hand-sweep with a broom everytime I run this. I'm an engineer by trade, and no amount of cleaning or maintenance can make this thing work as advertised. don't buy this if you own a dog. hair constantly gets tangled, and it's difficult to clean out. Also on the hardwood floor it often takes several passes to pick things up, especially if going in reverse. Very compact and convenient though, I like the design! Just a few things on the execution they could have done better.
customer_reviews.author: Telemachos Manos

customer_reviews.title: Shark Duo
customer_reviews.text: I waited a long time before I finally decided to buy this. I like having two batteries and the soft roll brush at the front. It is really easy to clean. After emptying it I blow it out with dust off and it keeps it very clean. It’s also pretty quiet. I was concerned about the small dust cup, but it really hasn’t been a problem since it’s so easy to empty. It’s quite a bit heavier than most cordless vacuums. It’s also a lot more expensive than most except the Dyson. I’ve never used a Dyson so I can’t compare.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline S Hadley

customer_reviews.title: Consider 2 batteries.
customer_reviews.text: We have a Shark Rotator that can be used as an upright or as a canister. I prefer the upright, my wife the canister. But we wanted something smaller and more convenient for the kitchen, laundry, and quick pick ups. So we got the cordless DuoClean Ultra-Light. I could not be more pleased. The dust cup is too small to clean the whole house, but that is not why we bought it. It takes about 3.5 hours to charge the battery, but that's why we bought two. It is more expensive than the corded model, but it is much more convenient. Very handy, easy to use, does a nice job.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Cullen

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog who sheds a lot, and sometime I need to vacuum twice per day. This Shark cordless ultra light is a blessing! My downstairs floor is wooden with upstairs carpeted, so I keep the heavier duty vacuum upstairs. This Shark has not disappointed. I also use the hand-held portion at max speed for vacuuming the carpet on my stairs and it works great. This hand held feature is what ultimately pushed me toward this particular brand. My sister in law has a Dyson and stated she liked mine better. Only issue I have had is difficulty separating hand-held portion from the wand, which sometimes I have my husband do for me.
customer_reviews.author: Susan George

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stand on its own
customer_reviews.text: This is a horribly designed product. First it says light weight but is quite heavy. Also you cannot have the vacuum stand upright without putting the dust cup in the down position. Terribly inconvenient because if you need to leave the vacuum at anytime you have to stop and put the hand held dust cup in the down mode so it can stand on its own. The vacuum does not adjust easily from carpet to floor. You need to lift it up to go onto the carpet from floor and it is quite heavy as I mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: barbara dehn

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight! Easy to use, cleans hardwood well and loooove the allergen seal and duo clean technology!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a shark vacuum for a while since they've come out with the DuoClean Technology!! I almost got the original but the cordless/portable option made it worth the few $$ difference!!! I am obsessed with this vacuum. 10/10 would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: simplesays

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it, getting something else
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I’ve always wanted a cordless vacuum and I’ve only had this since March but I’m thinking about just getting another basic vacuum. The battery life is only about 20 minutes and I have the clean the head at least once a week because of how tangled hair and things get in it, the way you have to grip the handle it irritates your hand by rubbing constantly, maybe it’s just because I have small hands and sausage fingers but that is a downside. I feel the suction sucks and it doesn’t deep clean the carpets. Honestly it’s much more of a hassle than it’s worth, I’ll be looking yet again at another vacuum to get.
customer_reviews.author: Angelea Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical but it works great! LOTS of suction, only problem is it fills up the dirt cup pretty quickly, maybe it's just my old carpet. Runs about 20 minutes or so one battery. Just enough time to clean a couple of rooms very well or a quick once over on the main walkways in the whole house! Easy to use, very light, cleans very well, even the corners.
customer_reviews.author: D. Land

customer_reviews.title: GREAT on hardwood, area rugs and carpet!
customer_reviews.text: Best vacuum HANDS DOWN! +it’s cordless!! I use it at least twice a day on hardwood, area rugs and carpet. I have a 3 year old, 5 year old, and a husband that works construction. This vacuum is powerful, lightweight, and comes with 2 rechargeable batteries! It’s so easy for me to grab it from its corner and clean up the house with no fuss with a cord. I bought this vacuum over a year ago and I still have NOTHING but good things to say about it! So glad I talked myself into buying myself an almost $300 vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: We Like It
customer_reviews.text: This Shark battery vac is better than we thought-----so far. It is more of a good suctioning carpet sweeper as the suction isn't real high, but perfect for our intended use. With sewing, there are lots of threads, fabric pieces, etc and this make quick work of cleaning up the area....on carpet or had floor. We don't use it as our main whole house vac but certainly could for quick touch-up. We recommend the 2 battery unit as the batteries don't last all that long. Easy to use and easy to dump. It is a tad pricey for what it is, but we're happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: GMAN

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a cordless vacuum and saw many great reviews of this vacuum. Now that we’ve had it for about a month we are pleased to say it works wonderfully. From quick clean ups to deep cleaning it does great. I thought the “flex” feature was kind of gimmicky at first, but after using is for a while I never new how easy cleaning under furniture could be. I’m glad we have two batteries. One stays charging while we use the other. We can clean out 1600 sq feet of floors using a single battery with high suction enabled.
customer_reviews.author: D_Rod

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it about a week. It does a good job. It's lightweight. It seems like it propels itself, and makes vacuuming easy. The vacuum itself doesn't take up much space - which is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie L. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: This vac is powerful & battery life is good in the "normal" mode
customer_reviews.text: I just got the Ion Flex w/the 2 batteries. It came fast, even tho I live in Hawaii. This vac is powerful & battery life is good in the "normal" mode. The 2nd battery is very nice. Light, compact when folded, & maneuverable. I like the rollers that act as dry dust mops, it's easy to use the flex tube. I wish you could remove the dirt cup for washing. There is no way to easily carry the attachments. Overall a time-saver because there's no cord, 2 batteries, & the fuzzy rollers virtually eliminate sweeping.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value Awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: My previous coded shark was great except the cord, this sucker is amazing, great fold down storage 2 batteries amazing brush head, and high/low speeds with carpet or bare floor settings. 4 accessories for various cleaning needs, rapid battery charging with easy battery changing on unit. Pick up is amazing, I’ve been able to use it on battery saver mode with no problems and I have a sheddy pooch!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: slick advertising - poor in reality
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this piece does bend and the ads show how easy it is to get under furniture. But if you still have to bend/twist, so it doesn't help with back issues, plus the length isn't long enough to get under many pieces, such as beds. As for cleaning. It was fine the first go round or two. We emptied the cup. Started the sweeper up again. We took a look. It had left dust everywhere, including lines of dust. We washed the roller per instructions. No change. We hand vacuumed the bristles and non-removable orange "pads". No change. Called support. Did everything. No change. Returned the item. Recommendation: Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: nonegiven

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our shark wired vacuum with this and have found it so worth the money spent the wireless operation and the eases of use is so much better. This one comes with two batteries so you always have one ready to use. Glad we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Duvall

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum! I live in about 1,600 sqft. Not big but I hated vacuuming and having to unwind the cord, move the plug, rewind the cord and most of all hold the cord when you go back and forth and it was always in the way. Hated the cord. The battery lasts my whole place and even with max power for the carpet areas. I don’t feel it needs the max power but I use it to try to use up the battery. Since this vacuum is much easier to do it is now on my 7 year old son’s chore list. And he doesn’t fight me on that chore.
customer_reviews.author: Moose1178

customer_reviews.title: One battery is good, the other NOT!! Shark does not stand behind their warranty.....
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Shark Duo that came with two batteries. After several months, one of the batteries will not hold a charge and lasts only a few minutes in the machine. Called for warranty replacement and they told me it would cost me $20.00 to ship another battery to me. Plus the other one had to be shipped back! No wonder it comes with two batteries, you get one good one and an obvious reject battery for the second one!! Don't bother buying from this company, they don't stand behind their "warranty."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No good for pets!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this thing. My biggest issue out of the box (it was pre owned) was it was filthy. The filters were full of dirt and dust and so was the canister. I assumed it would have been cleaned and I expected before being resold. I cant speak for battery life as I did t make it look g enough for the battery to die. The brush head was clogged with dog hair from one room. I had to use pliers to clean it out. I gave it another shot in another room and bam, clogged. It worked great on the dust so if you have no pets its probably a great little vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Heather L.

customer_reviews.title: Worst vacuum I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum wouldn't even pick up cat hair or lint, and kept cutting off on me. Plus, I had to wash the foam filters almost every 3rd time I used it and wait while they dried. It hardly had any power at all and the batteries don't last very long either, and I own a very small one level house. The concept is a good. Manufacture a small, portable, rechargeable vacuum the is also powerful enough to clean rugs and floors too. However the product does not live up to it's hype.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Convenient To Use
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I am very happy with this vacuum. So quick to grab it, unfold the shaft and put it to work. Does a good job of picking up debris. The two batteries are a great feature. The high power option is helpful. Down sides are the small size of the cleaning head and the small size of the dirt canister. It does feel a little flimsy so we will see how it holds up over time. It does have a good warranty, hopefully we don't have to find out how well the warranty works.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Lindros

customer_reviews.title: Shark vs. Dyson
customer_reviews.text: Brush wheel spins when in hard floor mode. Dyson has separate brushes. Dyson is lighter and more manageable. Decision goes to Dyson but 2 batteries help though not as long lasting per charge.
customer_reviews.author: G-MAN

customer_reviews.title: A Great Vac
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this vac for Almost a year. I had a Dyson Animal. This vac pulls you along on the carpet setting. The second roller doesn’t come out and is hard to clean. Battery life is just right. Gets into small places. I would not buy again. Hair wraps around an unremoveable roller and has to be dug/cut out. Gross. Dyson is a better all around vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I love this soooooo much! It light and has a good amount of power. I will have that you will need a 2nd battery. The battery doesn’t last super long. If you keep it on half power it will last longer but you will definitely need that 2nd battery. The filters are easy to clean and then put the whole thing back together. I do like that it folds in half to tuck away easily. I have recommended it to several people and will continue too.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Great for light cleaning, not for heavy use
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this vacuum for anyone who needs to do light cleaning in a smaller household. For anyone who does heavy cleaning frequently (like with pets and kids) this vacuum just doesn’t hold up. Cons- The battery often dies before I can even finish one floor of my house, it gets clogged easily and can be hard to clear. Dirt holder is small and needs to be emptied frequently. Don’t even bother using the turbo more because it will drain the battery within minutes Pros- Super lightweight and maneuverable. The hinge in the middle makes it very easy to clean under tables, beds etc. Works well on carpets and hard flooring.
customer_reviews.author: Buyin stuff

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum cleaner. It's easy t maneuver, it's relatively light and easy to empty dust bin. I like the various options for use that come standard with it. I've actually bought 2 of these now (one for our home and one for our business) and I'm going to buy another for my parents. I don't think that I have s single real complaint about this thing, except that it doesn't vacuum the house by itself.
customer_reviews.author: PatriciaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: No battery life
customer_reviews.text: No battery life. Expected to be very happy with the cordless shark. It picks up great for about 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great if you have dogs !!
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum, I have hardwood and tile floors in the main area of my house and I have two dogs (labs). This vacuum gets all the dog hair in all the hard to reach areas. The battery life if great, even on high I get at least 20 minutes of cleaning time which is perfect for a quick cleanup every day. The tools and the extended arm make cleaning so much easier than before!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan K. Aschoff

customer_reviews.title: Close to useless - overheats within 1minute
customer_reviews.text: I loved this vacuum initially - it had so much suction that it was amazing. However, it overheats within 1-2 minutes, on rugs (short or long; seems OK on hardwood). I can get 4 one-minute bursts of vacuuming if every minute I turn the vacuum off, and pull out any fuzz from the brush and base of the shaft (where it all piles up). On the 4th cycle, it overheats regardless and I have to wait ~30minutes before I can hoover the other side of my 8x10 rugs. I hate that I wasted my money on this.
customer_reviews.author: lina

customer_reviews.title: buy it.
customer_reviews.text: who SMILES when vacuuming! - i have been! because it is so friggin' light, maneuverable, reaches into areas below low furniture, easy to carry upstairs, easy to empty. if only battery lasted longer - runs about 40 minutes :( :( and that even on energy saving power mode - so i can't vac the whole house at one go. also wish they'd do away with the crazy colors, black would suit me just fine
customer_reviews.author: gail bishop

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying this for pet hair; stop now. I really wanted to like this vacuum, but constantly overheats and gets clogged pretty much after every use. I spend most of my time dissembling and having to poke out the clogs. The shaft just isn't large enough to pass the hair and it quickly jams. Its also not very easy to dump the collection chamber because the hair doesn't go from the first chamber to the second. I have to basically pull it out by hand. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Terri M. Pendleton

customer_reviews.title: Overheats
customer_reviews.text: I am torn. When the vacuum works...its amazing. Great on hardwood/tile, amazing on carpet... BUT.. it overheats due to being battery operated, and i can vacuum maybe 5-10 minutes before it shuts down. It is a veryyyy sensitive machine. If it didn't overheat and shut off, it'd be 9.8/10.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Battery is the weak link
customer_reviews.text: The Shark IonFlex DuoClean is a great vacuum and does a very good job, but the weak link in the battery. Lucky if the battery lasts 10 minutes and then 3 hours to charge it. Also if you buy another battery, it is very expensive. I can not recommend this product because of the short battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Arman G Allen

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love my IONflex! I only have wood and tile and have been very happy with this purchase. The brushes and suction do a great job at picking up debris. I haven’t used the attachements other to vacuum my car but they work great as well. I enjoy that it folds and can stand on its own without having to lean it up against anything. We have a 2k sqft house and if I do a quick vacuum i can get done with just one battery, if I take my time I end up needing to grab my second battery.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Langley

customer_reviews.title: poorly made
customer_reviews.text: after six seven months the catch that keeps the vacuum upright broke and shark says it is not covered
customer_reviews.author: JAMES H.

customer_reviews.title: No Cord
customer_reviews.text: Love this Shark cordless. I have arthritis and have had both hips replaced and a knee so always had to worry about tripping over the cord. I decided to try the Shark and can't believe how well it works. Lots of power and so much easier on me. It has two batteries so if one runs down just pop it on the charger and put the charged one in and ready to go again. Can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Frazee

customer_reviews.title: Changed My Life!
customer_reviews.text: OMG where has this vacuum been all my life? Okay, I'm being (slightly) hyperbolic, but this is really a dream machine. Lightweight, easy to maneuver, snakes under beds, couches, chairs, and sucks up pretty much everything. Transforms into a dustbuster with magical ease, and then folds up on itself and goes to sleep in the closet. Now if only it could cook ....
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

customer_reviews.title: Overall I really like this product
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really like this product. It is very light weight and easy to use, and I love how the smaller head easily gets under furniture. It is very good about picking up the dust on the hard wood floors. I do wish there was the option of turning off the brush roller and just using the smoother roller. And depending on which option you use, it can be a little awkward on the stairs. I get a good 15 minutes out of the battery. The only real complaint is how long it takes to recharge the battery. I have looked in to buying another battery but at $100.00 this is pricey.
customer_reviews.author: retired1234

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Will not work as advertised. Returned. Not enough suction just rolls over stuff leaving the floor dusty.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FROM THEM
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY FROM THEM~!!! just a tip... or a warning more like <3 do NOT buy from Amazon Seller - Good As New Electronics. as even if they send you a shark vacuum that doesn't work they don't pay for return shipping to return the item you can't even use... THAT IS NOT good customer service!!! :( WE ARE VERY DISAPPOINTED !! #**** this is what they messaged me back BELOW***** we do not pay for return shipping when items are being returned for refunds for any reason. I think sending an item that doesn't work should void this... just saying... UGH! THIS MOMMA IS NOT HAPPY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Rico

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This is the best rechargeable vacuum I’ve had! It has incredible suction. I actually prefer using this over my Dyson on most occasions! I hope they don’t change the positive things about this vacuum. Seems like once a company has a good thing, they change over to cheaper parts and labor to make more money therefore, making a lesser product. I hope this doesn’t happen to this product.! Keep on doing what you’re doing!
customer_reviews.author: M. K.

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum, poor battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I only have one complaint and that is battery life. Thought it would be great not fighting with a cord, but I can’t finish a room with the battery. That’s vacuuming the hard wood floors and the rug. The vacuum it’s self is great, cleans up all the dust from the hard wood floors, no more sweeping before I vacuum. Just wish I could give it a higher rating, but can’t because of battery life. I hate to have to spend more money on another battery.
customer_reviews.author: Cowgirlongreen

customer_reviews.title: Way outperforms the Dyson I USED to have and JUNKED!  Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This cordless vacuum way outperforms the Dyson Motörhead V6 I had. I was so bugged with my Dyson. The Dyson was always stopping, a strange on and off pulsing. I called the company and emailed and also had to research fixes on YouTube. These worked sometimes, but it kept having problems. I shouldn’t have to take my vacuum completely apart every time I want to vacuum. The Shark’s battery life is much longer, I’m able to actually finish my vacuuming! Easy to empty. It has a stronger surge button for heavier jobs.
customer_reviews.author: M.K.

customer_reviews.title: Best Stick Vacuum I’ve Tried
customer_reviews.text: Have tried a couple different stick vacuums and this is probably my favorite. The suction is pretty good. Some rugs can be a bit difficult. Also you can’t turn the brush completely off ever. I didn’t think I’d use the bending function that much, but I love it! It’s great for getting under beds, cribs, changing tables, etc. Battery goes a bit fast.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Not great on carpets.
customer_reviews.text: Suction does not seam as good as my regular Shark. The hand portion is so much heavier than the portion on the floor that it is somewhat awkward to manoover. My main reason for buying was that it was cordless and it was a Shark. It’s good for everyday quick “dog hair” pick ups off the tile floors but I prefer my regular shark for the carpets.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie

customer_reviews.title: Completely clean and fully charged unit keeps shutting off almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: LOVED this vacuum when I first got it. First I couldn't believe I spent $400 on a vacuum, but once I started using it, I quickly fell in love and was happy about my decision. Unfortunately, it started giving me issues only 2 months in, where it shuts off either a few seconds to maybe 2 minutes into using it. I've kept it clean and looked into fully charging the batteries, making sure the entire tube is cleared, cleaning the filter, and everything. Nothing will get this thing to work for longer than 2-3 minutes making it totally useless. So, unfortunately, I have no choice but to leave a 1-star review and warn anyone of buying this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Chop

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: If you are not ready to spend $400-$600 for a Dyson, the Shark IONFlex is a great choice. The power nozzle does a nice job on carpeting and floors. Not the lightest stick vac, but not a boat anchor either. Controls and displays are easy to use. It comes with 2 battery packs so you can always have one ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: RPNY67

customer_reviews.title: Awful Product!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this just about 4 months. Our house is 90% tile flooring. It has started overheating after about 10 minutes of use. I have checked the airflow for blockage, cleaned filters, looked online for advice-nothing helps. Online reviews of customer service are terrible. DO NOT BUY THIS OVERPRICE PRODUCT! To add injury to insult I have missed the very short return period. Awful product, awful company.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: OK For Spot Jobs
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, my plan for this vacuum was simply to clean baseboards and tight spaces like bathrooms. It would never work for our whole house because it just doesn't have the kick and the suction required for that job. We have an appreciable amount of pet hair and that job is best left to the regular vacuum cleaners. So, if you have a small space with little need for great suction this may work for you or if you have limited use like we have for just spot cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love vacuum. Not crazy about attachments. Should come with short hose. Attachments aren't really usable. Awkward angle.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive warranty. Bad faith?
customer_reviews.text: Shark informed me that nothing about the $80 Douclean carpet/floor motor head is covered under warranty under "etc" in the clause "Normal wear and tear of wearable parts (such as foam filters, HEPA filters, pads, etc.)". Thus when a wheel bearing failed prematurely, they made me purchase a new floor motor head with the concession of 1/2 price & no shipping (about $40). Gives new meaning to the company name "Shark" so buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: L.V. F.

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this vacuum 5 months ago and it no longer works. Only have regular cleaning in our home, nothing heavy duty. I clean the brushes, the tube, the filters and empty the canister constantly. It tuns for a short time and over heats. Cleaned the filters with water and allowed them to completely dry. Same problem as before. Now it barely picks up anything on our short rug and only runs for a short period of time. Have tried to contact the seller, not satified at all. Really poor product.
customer_reviews.author: James Geissler

customer_reviews.title: Love my vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Refurbished, came with all parts and attachments, including an extra battery, and works great! Love it. I have shallow area rug and wood floors - this vacuum goes great over both and I don't really have to change it from floor to rug. Hated dragging around my old canister style vacuum, this one is lightweight and smaller so it's much easier to store. Shipped sooner than expected, had to have my neighbor get it off my porch since I was away; but it was nicely packaged, no damage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just say no!!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this vacuum. It is great when it actually works. However, I went through 3 and then gave up. Amazon graciously provided replacements but I’m just done. FYI, I did keep up with all the maintenance and at it’s longest lasted about 6 months. I do have three pets but I feel like it should be able to handle that.
customer_reviews.author: Sara H.

customer_reviews.title: Very versitile unit
customer_reviews.text: I really like the easy access and light weight of the unit. It is so nice to have it handy for quick cleanup. The battery lasts me for the entire house, even with carpet mode and high suctioning.
customer_reviews.author: S. Reese

customer_reviews.title: No Brainer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I used my big Hoover on an area before retiring it, and this little guy picked up a bunch more afterward. Worth. I need another battery though-just like any other rechargeable. Multiple settings are user friendly-actually everything about it is user friendly. Should have come with a tool caddy or holder ; you get a variety of nice tools, although the corner, brush combo tool is hard to engage/disengage. Doing the ceiling corners was a breeze, the easy switching between floor & carpet, and the elbow are great I'm about to go use it in the car now. I don't see ever going back.
customer_reviews.author: Sulu

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Vac
customer_reviews.text: If you can love a vacuum I love this one. It came with two batteries (it was a deal) but one is more than enough for my use. My prior small cordless Shark left my full size Dyson in the dust but this one puts both to shame. It's lightweight, incredibly easy to maneuver and works beyond my expectations. The vacuuming gets done faster and easier. What's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good suction IF201..
customer_reviews.text: I have had other cordless stick vacs , this is the best , granted the others were cheaper ( showing once again you get what you pay for ) but I am enjoying this vac . Suction is very good , battery run time very good I did two rooms and my car it is down to one bar of three. Attachments for any cleaning job , since I just got it only question is just how durable it is , time will tell ..
customer_reviews.author: Jimflutes

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I love my vacuum! Lightweight heavy duty on vacuuming easy to store off in corner wherever. Doesn’t spread small crumbs all over sucks them all up I have dark wood floors and it makes them look so pretty again! Works great on carpet. Battery life is not great on high suction so I would recommend the extra battery but I only use high suction once a week and regular suction daily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Small Spaces
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I got the vacuum with the extra battery! This vacuum is great for small spaces and light duty messes. It got the job done for what I needed. The only thing is, the battery does not last long on the higher power mode. I know its cordless so its not meant to last all day, but I thought it would have lasted a bit longer on high power. All in all - good for low maintenance, light messes, wish the battery was better, very easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.author: Andi Caskey

customer_reviews.title: Handiest vacuum ever
customer_reviews.text: This is one handy vacuum. Lightweight (compared to a full size vac) and articulating, you can use it several different ways. The long piece between the motor and vac head can be removed to make a nice furniture vac. The flexible extension is really handy for chasing dust bunnies under furniture.
customer_reviews.author: D Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight and ease of storage for this vacuum. It gives what I think is a thorough clean of even my thicker carpets. The flexibility allows me to clean thoroughly under beds. Just taking the top part and using it as a hand held cleaner makes it simple to clean between seams in furniture and cars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne A. Mcgarvey

customer_reviews.title: It sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Just saying! I love this thing. Coming for a vacuum that wasn’t picking anything up, I’m so happy to have one that finally works. It makes vacuuming fun. It’s easy to maneuver, it picks up everything. I’m obsessed with the detachable hand vacuum as well. My only complaint is the battery life. But I found through my research that this was the issue with all cordless vacuums. Even the $700 ones.
customer_reviews.author: Corrin Crowder

customer_reviews.title: Shark beats Dyson again!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love Shark Products. I own a full-size uptight vacuum that I still use and love but I wanted something cordless. I have a toddler and a dog that sheds a lot And I was looking for something that I can pull out quickly, numerous times a day. The vacuum works very well and has great power on hardwood, tile and carpet. I can empty the canister easily and quickly and I love the attachments that come with it. Would absolutely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Herr

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend for carpet use.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product to use on carpet and hardwood. Very impressed with the hardwood cleanup but extremely disappointed with the carpet option. It didn’t not pick up everything even if on the max power setting. Would not recommend for carpet use. Battery life was good though.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Hutson

customer_reviews.title: Hardly any suction power.
customer_reviews.text: Would have been a great product if the suction worked. It picked up hair but no small debris. When the battery ran out (after only 10 minutes) it dumped in a pile all the things it hadn't really picked up when I lifted it to put it away. Returned. Not worth it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C.

customer_reviews.title: Makes vacuuming easy
customer_reviews.text: I hate lugging a heavy annoying corded vacuum up and down stairs—which meant I didn’t vacuum enough. This is so easy, light, and versatile that even my kids were happy to vacuum (seriously!). I didn’t get one for a long time because I was worried it wouldn’t have enough suctioning power. I should not have worried. Works great. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl G

customer_reviews.title: multiple times it get clogged.
customer_reviews.text: The problem with machine is that the area between the head of the vacuum and the joint that connects to the handle. It keeps on getting clogged. It is really hard to get it fixed You have to constantly peer into it and clean it up. It is really annoying. I feel like I am doing that more than cleaning my house.
customer_reviews.author: Bhattara

customer_reviews.title: Front roller drive gear broke in 8 months of light normal use They want to charge me to replace it?
customer_reviews.text: I used this for light normal rug cleaning every 10-14 days on carpet for 8 months. A front plastic drive gear broke into pieces. Now they want to charge me to replace it - Ridiculous waste of 100's of dollars on a product with the worst warranty ever!!! I will never buy shark again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is extremely short. I have a fairly small home (2 bedroom/2 bathroom) and I cannot vacuum entire space on one battery pack. In addition I have owned this machine for a whole THREE MONTHS and one of the battery packs has stopped taking a charge. The company is refusing to replace the obviously DEFECTIVE BATTERY. They want to CHARGE ME for THEIR FAULTY EQUIPMENT. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Brazsky

customer_reviews.title: dyson vs shark
customer_reviews.text: Did some research on dyson and shark cordless , unfortunally , can't really find the suction power specs on either. However, i had the Shark ionflex 205, which worked good but would get jammed on some quarter size papers. I bought this newer version, used it for 3 days so far and it hasn't jammed up once. Suction is better than previous models. I would say buy this vs dyson because of huge price difference. Read it some where dyson is expensive because of its hair filter. I'm in the market for the best cordless suction power, so i went with this.
customer_reviews.author: junaid raza

customer_reviews.title: Expected so much more for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the most expensive vacuum I have ever owned, but has the worst performance by far. Despite diligently emptying the dirt cup and removing and washing all filters after every use, each time I vacuum I am interrupted by something clogging or overheating. In five months of owning this vacuum, only twice have I been able to complete my vacuuming without encountering a problem. I love that it's lightweight and cordless, but it's way too high maintenance for me
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great unless you have long hair
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this vacuum. Light and very maneuverable - easily go from hardwoods to carpet. Battery lasted a few quick rounds. Kind of annoying that it doesn't stand on its own - you have to fold it over to stay upright. My biggest issue is the rollers get stuck with my hair. I have medium length hair and assume I shed an average amount but every time I use this vacuum I have to cut my hair from the rollers or they won't turn. I would expect this from a cheap appliance but expected more from the Dyson.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Rapp

product_meta.title: Shark DuoClean Cordless Ultra-Light Vacuum IONFlex, IF201, Green
product_meta.description: Color:GreenSharkNinja DuoClean Cordless Ultra-Light Vacuum Shark IONFlex, IF201, Green
feature_bullets: Dust cup capacity - 0.3 quarts. Removable ION Power Pack lithium-ion battery
Upgradeable runtime with additional batteries sold separately
MultiFLEX Technology folds over for compact, free-standing storage and provides flexible reach to get under beds, couches, and tables
DuoClean Technology a combination of bristle brush and soft roller invented to clean fine dust and small and large particles on both carpets and floors

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,430 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Single Battery, Single Charger, Single Cradle, Duster Crevice Tool, Wide Upholstery Tool, Dusting Brush, Anti-Allergen Dust Brush
